summary: The federal government is required to allocate at least 23% of its direct contract spending to small businesses. The Small Business Administration's annual scorecards track progress toward that goal. SBA changed how it calculates scores for fiscal year 2017 but didn't initially plan to evaluate the effect of the changes. We recommended SBA evaluate its new scoring methodology to assess how effectively the scorecards measure...
title: Small Business Administration: Actions Needed to Improve Confidence in Small Business Procurement Scorecard
